Title: FG to hold manufacturers, importers responsible for plastic pollution
Summary: Federal Government has announced plans to begin full enforcement of the Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) framework by 2025 . Federal Government to hold manufacturers, importers responsible for plastic pollution .

Title: Don’t allow Benue killings in South-East, Ohanaeze tells govs
Summary: A faction of the apex Igbo socio-cultural organisation, Ohanaeze Ndigbo, told govs . Don’t allow Benue killings in South-East states, the group says .

Title: WHO unveils guideline to improve pregnancy out comes in women with SCD
Summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) has released its first-ever global guideline on the management of sickle cell disease (SCD) during pregnancy . The guideline addresses growing health challenges that can have life-threatening consequences for both women and babies .

Title: Coalition raises alarm over alleged military threats after Yelwata massacre statement
Summary: Coalition raises alarm over alleged military threats after Yelwata massacre statement . National Coalition Against Mass Killings and Impunity raises concerns about alleged threats and potential harassment of its members by the military .

Title: LBS strengthens global standing in FT ranking
Summary: The Lagos School (LBS) has been listed as Africa’s Premier Premier School . The school has been ranked in the world's top 20 Executive Education ranking . LBS is Africa's Premier School for Africa .

Title: With what’s going on, I may leave PDP soon — Suswam
Summary: Gabriel Suswam declared that he may soon dump the party if the situation is not resolved . The former Benue State Governor said he may leave PDP soon . He said with what's going on, I may leave the party soon .

Title: Again, court jails ‘Mama Boko Haram’ two others for N11m contract fraud in Maiduguri
Summary: Aisha Alkali Wakil, popularly known as Mama Boko Haram, was jailed again for contract scam involving N11 million . Tahiru Saidu Daura and Prince Lawal Shoyode were sentenced to 14 years imprisonment each .

Title: CBN to diversify Nigeria’s reserve base — Cardoso
Summary: The Governor of the CBN, Mr. Olayemi Cardoso, gave the hint at the opening of the Afreximbank Annual Meetings (AAM) in Abuja . Foreign Reserve diversification refers to the practice of central banks and monetary authorities .

Title: ELECTRICITY: Nigeria records largest number without access — World Bank
Summary: The number of people without access to electricity in Nigeria is put at 86.8 million, the highest world-wide . This is third consecutive year of this report showing Nigeria in the lowest position globally . The report, released yesterday, was released yesterday .

Title: Demolition: LASBCA distances self as Sanwo-Olu’s aide urges Obi to report case to police
Summary: The Lagos State Building Control Agency (LASBCA) denies involvement in the alleged demolition of a property belonging to the brother of Labour Party’s presidential candidate, Mr. Peter Obi .

Title: [PHOTOS] Hijrah 1447: Annual Kaabah cover replacement begins in Mecca
Summary: The traditional ceremony of replacing the Kiswa (cover) of the Holy Kaabah at the Grand Mosque in Mecca commenced on Wednesday evening . The new Kiswa is made from natural black-dyed silk, intricately embroidered with gold and silver threads . It is expected to be completed by Thursday morning, marking the first day of

Title: Police hunt killers of female farmer in Ondo
Summary: Mrs Rabiat Atere's lifeless body was found on her farm in Oka-Akoko, Akoko South-West Local Government area of Ondo State . The cause of her death remains a mystery as it has not been ascertained at the time of filing this report, but some residents suspected that she was killed by suspected

Title: Vietnam-Nigeria trade hits $1bn in 2024 - Envoy
Summary: The Vietnamese Ambassador to Nigeria, Mr Bui Quoc Hung, said trade between Vietnam and Nigeria reached an all-time high of 1 billion dollars in 2024, making it the first time the trade volume between the two countries exceeded 600 million dollars . Bui stated this in an interview with the News Agency of Nigeria in Abuja on Wednesday

Title: Tinubu to sign tax reform bills Thursday
Summary: President Bola Tinubu will, on Thursday, sign into law four tax reform bills that will “transform Nigeria’s fiscal and revenue framework,” the Presidency has revealed . The four bills include: the Nigeria Tax Bill, Nigeria Tax Administration Bill, the Nigeria Revenue Service (Establishment) Bill, and the Joint

Title: 2027 VP: I’ll do whatever Tinubu wants, says Barau
Summary: Deputy President of the Senate, Barau Jibrin, has declared that he will fully support President Bola Tinubu’s decisions regarding the 2027 general election . Barau made this known on Wednesday, during a press briefing in Abuja, while responding to questions about calls from political groups urging the President to adopt him
